page.title: The Application Menu Bar

text_content.paragraph: The Application Menu Bar contains three main groupings of commands to help you conduct a Map search and to interact with the results. These are the Search and Analysis Toolbars, and the Help dropdown list. Click on each of the "plus" (+) buttons below to learn about each.

page.prompt: CLICK EACH GRAPHIC TO LEARN MORE. THEN CLICK THE NEXT ARROW TO CONTINUE.

cc_text.paragraph: The Application Menu Bar contains three main groupings of commands to help you conduct a Map search and to interact with the results. These are the Search and Analysis Toolbars, and the Help dropdown list. Click on each of the graphics below to learn about each element.

popText.paragraph: Using Search is the best method to quickly navigate to your geographic area. The Search toolbar contains these commands:

bullets.li: Print Map (to a PDF or Other Formats)
Search Type (assets, landgrid, or cultural locations)

popImg.alt: Graphic of the Search toolbar with the Search Type dropdown list expanded.

popText.paragraph: Selecting the Basemap button expands to show a list of the different basemaps (e.g., Roads (Bing), Imagery (Bing), Topo (ESRI) and Roads (ESRI)) that can be used to change the map format.

popImg.alt: Graphic collage of the Analysis toolbar with the Basemap dropdown list expanded.

popText.paragraph: Selecting the Drawing Tools button expands to show various drawing options such as, Draw a Point, Draw a Line, Draw Freeform and Draw Text.

popImg.alt: Graphic collage of the Analysis toolbar with the Drawing Tools expanded.

popText.paragraph: When the Analysis Tools button is selected it expands horizontally to display options such as Identify and Identify Buffer.

popImg.alt: Graphic collage of the Analysis toolbar with the Analysis Tools expanded.
